content.raw:
Hello, Just out of curiosity is the scoring_q1.rb still under active development? There are quite a few issues with the script as is. I have corrected the ruby issues (I can fork and submit if you like) but it is not doing the transforms for the lights at all yet.

I have also noticed it is currently using "upperNeckPitchLink" as the frame for the head. But in my experience exploring the frames of the robot "upperNeckPitchLink" and "head" are reported as different. If one thing, "head" is inverted and " upperNeckPitchLink" is not. 

```
rosrun tf tf_echo head world

- Translation: [0.014, -0.014, 1.630]
- Rotation: in Quaternion [0.997, 0.035, -0.064, -0.002]
            in RPY (radian) [-3.133, 0.129, 0.070]
            in RPY (degree) [-179.484, 7.378, 4.028]
```

```
rosrun tf tf_echo upperNeckPitchLink world

- Translation: [-0.017, 0.014, -1.542]
- Rotation: in Quaternion [-0.000, 0.001, -0.035, 0.999]
            in RPY (radian) [-0.000, 0.002, -0.070]
            in RPY (degree) [-0.022, 0.103, -4.011]
```

Should we be using upperNeckPitchLink in our qual1 code or is that still part of the work in progress?

-aric

I have also noticed it is currently using "upperNeckPitchLink" as the frame for the head. But in my experience exploring the frames of the robot "upperNeckPitchLink" and "head" are reported as different. If one thing, "head" is inverted and " upperNeckPitchLink" is not.

Should we be using upperNeckPitchLink in our qual1 code or is that still part of the work in progress?
